page.title: 12Sanquhar Today
page.content: Since 1953 Sanquhar has continued to grow in size and population - new housing being a reason for this. The town now has 7 policeman, 3 doctors and a number of nurses to look after the community. In 1976 the primary and secondary schools were split into two separate units, and in 1981 the primary school moved into brand new premises. In agriculture, yields and quality are greatly improved, but numbers employed therein are greatly reduced. As in the rest of the country new breeds of livestock, which have replaced our native stock, have been successfully introduced. With the closure of the two local pits, the town lost its most traditional form of employment, there are still miners who live in the town, but they have to travel up to 60 miles daily to the two mines in the nearby Ayrshire coalfield
